threads.com: Let's talk about defensive systems. What kinds do you like to see? Impenetrable physical armor? Energy shields and forcefields? Personally, I'm partial to the Geschmeidzig Panzer on the Forbidden, bending beams for both offense and defense is a cool concept.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
One of my favorites is the Mercurius' electromagnetic shield, using the funnel-like Planet Defensors to create fields in a dynamic way for things like covering multiple areas around the MS, in front of it, to protect an ally, etc.
In general, I love it when mechs use hand shields and the function similarly to the ones in antiquity but come with new features akin to the time: the Gyan with built-in laser beams on the shield, the Mercurius having that buckler shield that can project a beam sword from on the front, the Zeta Gundam using its shield as the Waverider's nose/Scirocco Penetrator, among others.

threads.com:
Rank the Cutie Honey adaptations. Here's mine:

S-tier: New Cutie Honey. Great writing, great voice acting, full of interesting villains and guest characters. 10/10 face and tits on Honey here
Good tier: Flash & OG anime. Beautiful visuals on both. OG has all those trippy backgrounds while Flash really ramps up the drama by the end.
Meh tier: Re. Not a fan of retarded Honey and bulldyke Natsuko. All style over substance and apes way too much from the 70s anime, which is typical for Annoshit. Hoping the live-action is better.
Shit tier: Universe. Utter fucking garbage. Cheap ugly animation (esp that CGI dimension where all the fights go on) and Honey is a dumb fucking cunt throughout. Only 12 eps and it alrealy feels like a slog to finish

Also been meaning to check out Tears and The Live. Thought on those?

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
Previous thread: >>21277686

Let's discuss the best TV series of UC Gundam.
>Should I skip ZZ?
No! ZZ is essential viewing. The First Neo Zeon War is as important as any other conflict in UC history. You miss out on essential character development(Haman & Kamille/Fa, Minerva Zabi), fantastic mecha designs, best OP/ED songs in UC, lots of great new characters (Elpeo Ple, Ple Two, Chara Soon, Roux Louka) including Judau who is one of the best protagonists in Gundam.
>But /m/ told me Moon Moon ruins the show
Absolutely not. Moon Moon is important canon wise now with Moon Gundam being a thing.
>I'm still not convinced
Haman, Kamille, Fa, Bright Noa and other favourites are still there. ZZ is still referenced in newer UC titles showing it's importance and longevity.

Did they ever explain why explosions in space battles were always colored pink?
Was it some sort of stylistic choice?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21314832
>>21314878

No, I think he's right to question it even as the person who posted >>21314821; sometimes things become such accepted wisdom that no-one questions them anymore, even if they never had a source to begin with. Which is dangerous, and how we end up with "Tomino wanted Gyunei to be Kamille" etc. hanging around for literal decades despite being obvious horseshit. I just accepted "Sunrise had an excess of pink" without questioning it, but upon looking into it, it's probably not actually true.

The Japanese Wikipedia article on Char notes that Ryousuke Hikawa, an anime and special effects researcher who has been working to document the industry since the late 70s thinks that the pink for Char's Zaku, among others, was specially mixed for the production during an interview on Gundam's production seen here: https://web.archive.org/web/20100917110018/http://animage.jp/old/col/col_01/col_01_06.html

> 特に強調したいのは、鮮やかの一語につきる色味だ。たとえばガンダムの胸はオリジナルのセルの色味では、よく商品化されている藍色ではなく、抜けるようなスカイブルーなのである。ブライト・ノアの髪の毛も黒ではなく濃緑色。シャア専用ザクやミライ、セイラの制服のピンクはこの作品のために調合された特色で……なんて、くどくど言わなくても画面から充分にそれが伝わってくる

> What I would like to emphasize in particular is the vivid color of the word. For example, Gundam's chest is a clear sky blue, not the indigo that is often commercialized in the original cell color. Bright Noah's hair is also dark green instead of black. Char's Zaku, Mirai, and Sayla's pink uniform were specially formulated for this work... well, you can tell that from the screen without saying too much.

>>21315581

I wonder if the pinks of the uniforms and Char's suits were two of the 3 he insisted on adding, in that case?

>>21318058
I've read all of Battle Angel Alita/Gunnnm.

Last Order is great. It's less "grim dark" compared to the first Battle Angel Alita manga. It's has more action and does a lot to expand the lore of Alita (Gunnm). We finally get to leave Earth and learn about the solar system. All the different space factions and their histories (and they how they relate to Earth). It also explains why Earth is in a state of disrepair and neglected. It's a good read.


The first Alita series is very dark and somber for a reason. The author was sick and thought he was going to die. So he wrote the series with the idea that he would die after completing it and didn't want to Leave fans with unfinished stories.

Last Order was made after the Author recovered from his illness and was more optimistic about his future that he could tell a larger story.

I think it's fair if the games themselves are trying to tell one continuous story. This isn't some Suikoden shit where each game is a self contained plot and conflict but in a shared world so we can see characters move around at different points in their lives getting involved in new conflicts. This is one, supposed, epic and honestly looking back on them, I can't for the life of me remember where any of the time actually went. Like i can probably remember specific instances, but the same way I can recall actual events and dungeons from other games. It certainly wasn't all spent on the characters, at least the CS games weren't, they have the same problem persona has where characters cant even so much tie their shoes if the MC isn't around for them to orbit. Hell CS1 suffered from so much character bloat that at most turns half the roster was just punted to the off screen. They absolutely wasted what the whole premise of Class 7 was supposed to be when outside maybe a single moment or pair they don't interact worth a damn at all because every single one of them has to exist in a vacuum so HAHAH man can do all their development for them. The series broke double digits but the actual meat and potatoes of the plot probably wouldn't even fit a shorter game. Even Xenogears Episode V shit still saw it as a self contained plot and even when Saga pulled the trilogy shit it felt like you were at least generally trying to get somewhere.

The Janissaries, Mamluks, Ghilman etc. were not chattel slaves themselves, no, but they were all bought and raised from chattel slaves into soldiers of the empire. They were afforded more respect and even wages as soldiers, but they were all taken as slaves in war and sold within a given empire until whichever empire took direct ownership of them and started training them. last_replies.name: Anonymous

>>21318887

There are no official records of the Confederacy using slaves as soldiers. They used them as labourers, but never as soldiers. There are a handful of anecdotal examples of Black people firing guns during battles, but nothing official and there are lots of examples of Confederate soldiers refuting the idea it happened too. It did nearly happen though, because the Confederate congress passed a law allowing it after years of debate resisted by people who hated the idea of allowing slaves to serve as soldiers about a week before the Confederacy was defeated, so it never had time to be instituted, but would have given more time.

***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21314631

It's combination of missiles to punish a pilot trying to stay at range and beam saber for close range and even bombs to help lay traps would work well for a guerilla fighter who seems to prefer melee range like Ral, yes.

>>21314751

I doubt it'd make any difference for his men either. None of them were notable pilots, and the White Base still had Hayato, Kai and Ryu around to protect it even when Amuro was gone.

>>21315009

It was the standard main and range weapon, and there's no reason to think M'Quve would supply Ramba and his men with optional equipment alongside the Doms even if you ignore that it didn't have any such optional equipment in Mobile Suit Gundam itself.

>>21315021

Amuro gets pushed to his limits defeating Ramba because Ramba is in a suit that compliments him, and my entire point was that the Dom would suit him less regardless of specs. Making him less of a threat, since it's not as good in melee, and it's main weapon is too slow to realistically hit Amuro. I don't think you can argue Amuro only started rapidly growing after Ral either, because there's several bits of evidence showing it well before he even encounters Ral. Amuro is taking out Zaku II's with his off hand while battling Char by episoe 4, we find out in episode 6 or 7 that he's done dozens of hours of practice in the simulator and Gundam itself over the few days the show has taken by that point, he's personally studying the Gundam to understand how it works all along, he designs combat routines for the Gouf once he encounters it because the Gundam's computer can't keep up etc.

Ramba was the first proper ace Amuro outright defeated, but he was training and improving at a similar pace way before he defeated him. He also fights all 3 Black Tri-Stars within a few days of defeating Ral too, and while none of them are up to Ral's standard alone, they're at least as much of a threat together.

threads.sub: Trider G7 goes to Bethlem - an unintentional mecha shitpost from 1982
threads.com:
So, as a pastanon I saw this post >>>21312574 and I feel like I wanted to find out what the fuck it was.
I found out that this comic is titled "Trider G7 goes to Bethlem" and it was published on "Il Corriere dei Piccoli", the first ever weekly comic magazine in Italy.
The comic was published during December 1982, and it was, unsurprisingly, a commercial for toys of said mechas. The whole story is just extremely weird, and the juxaposition between the biblical story and the robots is hilarious today.
In the spirit of Chirstmas, I decided to post the whole comic and to translate it as best as I can. Hope you enjoy the wild ride.

>(textbox): It's a freezing night and soon it will be snowing again. Joseph is very worried for Mary, who is about to give birth to a child, since he doesn't know where he can find shelter for her.
>(Joseph): Do not worry, my sweet Mary, you will see that some kind person will help us!
>(Joseph): I beg you, could you help us in this so cold night? My wife must give birth and find shelter!
>(woman): Go away! I do not let strangers in my house!
>(textbox): But Joseph's wishes do not come true. In fact, the response is negative one time again
>(Mary): Jospeh, I am so cold, what should we do?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21315204
And there it is the ad for the toys, as one could expect.
I had fun translating this, hope you had fun reading it too and happy early Christmas /m/!

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21313956

No. The original plan for ZZ, called Zeta Part II, essentially precludes Char's Counterattack entirely, because while Char's fate is never addressed in what notes we do have on it, his actual motives in the film would be largely gone. The show would have ended with Char having wiped out the heads of the Federation personally, before Judau directly inspired the people remaining on Earth to move off the planet and then leaving to help lead the colonization efforts on Mars. Char is largely acting to punish the people of Earth and to help Spacenoids in Char's Counterattack; which would be impossible when there are few if any people left on Earth, and those few moving to leave within short order anyway. He'd also presumably have been bested by Judau, and even if he was alive, have more of a recent rivalry with him than with Amuro.

ZZ was never meant to lead into Char's Counterattack, and the two works basically existed as opposing possibilities. It's probably worth pointing out that, despite people's views, Char's Counterattack is not the culmination of early UC, and some kind of cap to 0079, Zeta and ZZ. It's a movie Tomino made solely and specifically to address Amuro and Char's relationship. If anything is taken from Zeta in your opinion, then it's only in so far as it serves that narrative. Char's Counterattack isn't meant to act as an endpoint for the previous era of shows at all.

last_replies.com: Recently I downloaded the bluray release of Macross Frontier and I noticed that there are three versions for the 1st episode: Broadcast Edition, Deculture Edition and Yack Deculture Edition. What are their differences?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21314196
Deculture was an preview version of the first episode broadcast a few months ahead of the series proper. Basically, back in Dec 2007 TBS did a double-feature to commemorate the 25th anniversary of SDF Macross, with a short documentary followed by the Deculture Edition
Then Macross 7 started its regular TV run in April 2008, by which point they'd tweaked the first episode a bit. The Broadcast Edition is that one from Apr '08, which had a few scenes taken out to make space for the OP (which was not shown with the Deculture Edition) and to just pare it down slightly to fit a regular commercial TV timeslot. There is also apparently a bit of new footage added in a couple of places, but that's more extending scenes than outright adding or removing them
The Yack Deculture Edition is meant to be a 'complete' version, with all of the material from both Deculture and Broadcast versions edited into a single episode, running about 10 minutes longer than a regular episode
